intro: Echinospartum lusitanicum f. pulviniformis, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and pink to purple flowers. The plant features small, lobed leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas with full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
